snippet: Advisers to Mrs. Clinton, including the former president Bill Clinton, believe that her campaign made serious miscalculations by failing to undercut Mr. Sanders’s message early in the race.
abstract: Hillary Clinton's advisers are grappling with worries that her safe approach to Democratic primary race, particularly her failure to attack Bernie Sanders early on, may have given Sanders significant edge; Clinton supporters also cite too few debates, lack of competitive primary field and Sanders's unexpected surge in popularity and fundraising as causes for concern.
lead_paragraph: Advisers to Mrs. Clinton, including the former president Bill Clinton, believe that her campaign made serious miscalculations by failing to undercut Mr. Sanders’s message early in the race.

headline.main: Clinton Campaign Underestimated Sanders Strengths, Allies Say
headline.print_headline: Clinton Allies Have Regrets Over Strategy
